snippet: Economic data that is later revised, like figures on the gross domestic product and unemployment, might be too malleable to get a true picture.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column asserts that economic data that is later revised, like figures on the gross domestic product and unemployment, is too malleable to get a true picture of the economy's health.
lead_paragraph: Economic data that is later revised, like figures on the gross domestic product and unemployment, might be too malleable to get a true picture.

headline.print_headline: Elastic Numbers Make It Hard to Get a Handle on the Economy
headline.main: Elastic Numbers Make It Hard to Get a Handle on the Economy
